intro: Pyrrocoma subviscosa, commonly known as the sticky pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its sticky texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Pyrrocoma subviscosa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
